title: Ghost airport selling for $14,000
text:
What are these? Ghost town ... A man walks alongside the empty Central airport terminal in Ciudad Real, Spain. Source: AP 
A GROUP of Asian and British investors HAVE angled to snap up a disused airport in Spain for $14,000 - about 0.001 per cent of the cost of construction. 
A commercial court however said the offer by the group Tzaneen International for Ciudad Real Central Airport was too low, even though it was the only bidder. 
Tzaneen was set up in Spain by British, Chinese and other Asian investors to buy the airport about 200 kilometres south of Madrid. No holiday makers here ... Check-in desks stand empty at the Central airport in Ciudad Real, Spain. Source: AP 
A spokesman for Tzaneen said it had offered $14,000 to buy the site. 
In a statement the group added that it would invest up to $125 million to turn Ciudad Real into a “logistical hub” for Chinese imported goods. 
The commercial court in Ciudad Real has set 40 million euros as the minimum price for the airport, which is estimated to have cost about a billion euros to build. Left in ruins ... An unfinished terminal walk-way is just one of many structures that were never completed. Source: AP 
It is one of several so-called “ghost airports” in Spain, built during a construction frenzy that went bust in 2008, dragging the country into economic crisis. 
When it started operating in 2008 its promoters were hoping to attract airlines to run low-cost flights for foreigners heading to Madrid. 
But it was scuppered by an extension to Madrid’s main Barajas Airport, which absorbed all the extra demand. No where to go ... A plane sits on the runway at the airport. Source: AP 
Ciudad Real went bust with $400 million in debts and has been idle since 2011. 
A judge has ordered that the bidding period be extended in the hope of finding a higher offer. A final ruling is expected in mid-September. 
Another notorious “ghost airport” in Castellon near Valencia is due to reopen when Irish low-cost carrier Ryanair starts operating flights there in September.
